alert.note: Alert for Cabarrus (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 8:06PM EDT until September 30 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Cabarrus. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 802 PM EDT, Doppler radar was indicating heavy tropical showers redeveloping across the region and this additional rainfall may be enough to promote flooding of low-lying areas across the county. Isolated rainfall totals of around 3 inches are possible, especially south of highway 49, and in parts of the Rocky River headwaters. Spotty urban type flood issues may also be seen throughout greater Concord. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Kannapolis, Downtown Concord, West Concord, Harrisburg, Enochville, Mt Pleasant, Charlotte Motor Speedway, Coddle Creek Reservoir and Midland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
